name: recharter
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to give an organization a new charter (= a formal statement of its rights): His attempt to recharter the bank failed in the face of vigorous opposition from the president. This proposal is ultimately going to put pressure on multi-nationals to re-charter somewhere else.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is almost certain that they will not recharter the state lottery.In 1968, the decision was made to re-charter the FNMA as a private entity, funded entirely by shareholders.They dreamed of being able to recharter the world's major corporations and to produce a new economic system.

a new charter (= a formal statement of the rights of an organization) to replace one that existed previously: The trustees insisted that the college was not subject to government control or recharter. They joined together in opposing the national bank’s recharter.
